alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Petroleum (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 8:22PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Petroleum and southwestern Garfield Counties through 915 PM MDT... At 821 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Mosby, or 22 miles east of Winnett, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Winnett, Flatwillow, Sand Springs, Edwards, Mosby, Crooked Creek Rec Area, Petrolia Lake, Steve Fork, Cat Creek and Tiegen. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
